thread.title: Egypt anticipates pleasant weather with lower 30s temperatures in Cairo next week - EgyptToday
thread.title_full: Egypt anticipates pleasant weather with lower 30s temperatures in Cairo next week - EgyptToday

title: Egypt anticipates pleasant weather with lower 30s temperatures in Cairo next week - EgyptToday
text: According to the Egyptian Meteorological Authority (EMA), temperatures are expected to fall below the 30s in the North Coast, encompassing Alexandria and Matrouh. Exciting news awaits in South Sinai as autumn brings about lovely weather. If you are contemplating a holiday in Sharm El-Sheikh and Dahab, next week presents an opportune moment, with temperatures ranging from 32 to 35. Additionally, there is a chance of light rain in Halayeb and Shalateen in the southernmost region of Egypt next week. Weather conditions in Upper Egypt are predicted to enhance progressively throughout the week, particularly in the northern parts. By Thursday, daytime temperatures in northern Upper Egypt are expected to reach 30, while the southern region will see temperatures in the mid-30s by week's end. Overall, the EMA forecasts hot weather during the day across Egypt, moderate conditions in the evening, and cooler temperatures late at night. Motorists are advised to be cautious of possible intense water mist on highways, particularly in the North Coast, Central Sinai, and Suez Canal cities. Here is a breakdown of the anticipated average temperatures for the upcoming week, as of Monday: - Cairo and Lower Egypt: Highs of 31, Lows of 22 - North Coast: Highs of 28, Lows of 20 - South Sinai: Highs of 33, Lows of 23 - Northern Upper Egypt: Highs of 31, Lows of 19 - Southern Upper Egypt: Highs of 35, Lows of 22 Comments Leave a Comment
